intro: Pterichis habenarioides var. costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican pterichis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
